components.name: KeyValuePair
components.description: (standalone) - a single key-value pair
components.html: <!-- this component is not needed, as DataTreeNode already handles key-value pairs -->

The tool should be easy to use, intuitive, and provide a clear visual representation of the project timeline.

components.description: A line component that represents a dependency between tasks or milestones. Standalone.

User settings panel with notification an.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first user settings panel with two main sections: notification options and account options. The notification options section should have a heading, a list of toggle switches for different notification types, and a "Save Changes" button. The account options section should have a heading, a list of profile information (e.g. name, email), and an "Edit Profile" button.
User settings panel with notification an.html: User Settings

components.description: standalone component
components.html: Notification Options

Discussion Forums and Comments.description: A discussion forum with a list of comments and a form to add new comments. Each comment should display the user's name, the comment text, and a timestamp. The UI should have a clean and modern design, with adequate spacing and clear typography.

components.name: CommentCard
components.description: (standalone): Displays a single comment with user name, comment text, and timestamp.
components.html:
{username}

{comment_text}

{timestamp}

components.name: CommentForm
components.description: (standalone): A form to add a new comment.
components.html: <form className="flex gap-2 mb-4">  <input type="text" placeholder="Add a comment..." className="flex-1 p-2" />  <button className="bg-blue-500 hover:bg-blue-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4">Comment</button></form>

components.description: (takes children): A container for a list of comments.

components.name: DiscussionForum
components.description: (takes children): The main container for the discussion forum.
components.html: {children}

Messaging and Chat Systems.description: The UI should have a chat window with a list of conversations on the left and a messaging area on the right. The conversation list should display the user's name and a preview of the last message. The messaging area should display the conversation history and an input field to send new messages. The UI should be responsive and adapt to different screen sizes.

components.name: ConversationList
components.description: standalone component that displays a list of conversations
components.html: {conversations.map(conversation => ( ))}

components.name: ConversationListItem
components.description: standalone component that displays a single conversation item
components.html:
• {userName}

    {lastMessagePreview}

components.name: MessagingArea
components.description: standalone component that displays the conversation history and an input field
components.html: {messages.map(message => ( ))}

components.name: MessageBubble
components.description: standalone component that displays a single message
components.html:
{messageText}

{timestamp}

components.name: TextInput
components.description: standalone component that allows the user to input a new message
components.html: <input   type="text"   class="w-full p-2 pl-10 text-sm"   placeholder="Type a message..."/>

Search bar for finding products.description: The UI should be a simple search bar with a text input field and a submit button. The search bar should be responsive, taking up the full width on mobile devices and a maximum width of 400px on desktop devices. The input field should have a placeholder text "Search for products...". The submit button should have a search icon and the text "Search".

components.description: a standalone component that contains the search icon and text.

The blocks should be connected by lines to represent the flow of deals through the pipeline.

{label}

{dealCount} deals

components.description: (standalone): A connector line between two stages in the pipeline.

Custom Field Builder: Create tailored da.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first, and accessible interface for building custom data fields. It should consist of a header, a field-type selection section, and a field configuration section. The header should display the title "Custom Field Builder" and have an optional "Save" button. The field-type selection section should display a list of available field types (e.g., text, number, date, etc.). The field configuration section should display fields depending on the selected field type.

components.name: HeaderComponent
components.description: (standalone): Displays the title and optional save button.
components.html: Custom Field Builder

components.description: (standalone): Displays a list of available field types.

components.description: (takes children): Displays fields depending on the selected field type.
components.html: <!-- field configuration fields will be rendered here based on the selected field type -->{children}

Task Calendar: Schedule and assign tasks.description: The UI should display a calendar view with a list of tasks, allowing users to schedule and assign tasks to specific dates and team members. The UI should be responsive, with a mobile-first design that adapts to different screen sizes.

components.name: CalendarHeader
components.description: Standalone component that displays the current month and navigation buttons.
components.html: {currentMonth}

components.name: TaskList
components.description: Standalone component that displays a list of tasks.

components.name: TaskCard
components.description: Component that renders a single task, taking `{taskTitle}`, `{taskDescription}`, `{dueDate}`, `{assignedTo}`, and `{status}` as props. Can take children.
components.html:
• {taskTitle}

    {taskDescription}

    Due: {dueDate}

    Assigned to: {assignedTo}

    Status: {status}

    {children}

components.name: TaskForm
components.description: Standalone component that allows users to create a new task.
components.html: <form class="p-4 mb-4">  <label class="block" for="taskTitle">Task Title:</label>  <input class="w-full p-2" type="text" id="taskTitle" />  <label class="block" for="taskDescription">Task Description:</label>  <textarea class="w-full p-2" id="taskDescription"></textarea>  <DatePicker />  <AssigneeSelect />  <TaskStatusSelect />  <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">    Create Task  </button></form>

components.name: DatePicker
components.description: Standalone component that allows users to select a date.
components.html: <input class="w-full p-2" type="date" />

components.name: AssigneeSelect
components.description: Standalone component that allows users to select a team member to assign a task to.
components.html: <select class="w-full p-2">  <option value="">Select a team member</option>  <!-- Options will be populated dynamically --></select>

components.name: TaskStatusSelect
components.description: Standalone component that allows users to select a task status.
components.html: <select class="w-full p-2">  <option value="">Select a status</option>  <!-- Options will be populated dynamically --></select>

The chat window should display a list of chat messages, with the most recent messages at the bottom. The UI should be accessible, with clear typography, sufficient color contrast, and keyboard-navigable interactive elements.

The design should be mobile-first, accessible, and SEO-friendly. Each comment should have an avatar, username, comment text, and a reply button. Replies should be indented and have a different background color to differentiate them from top-level comments.

Message body text editor with formatting.description: The UI should resemble a text editor with a toolbar above the editing area, containing formatting tools such as bold, italic, underline, font size, and font family. The user should be able to input text into the editor and apply formatting to the selected text.

components.description: Standalone component, slider to adjust font size
components.html: <input   type="range"   min="8"   max="24"   value={fontSize}   onChange={handleFontSizeChange}   className="w-full"/>

Each teaser should have a subtle background color and padding to differentiate it from the others.

Search Bar.description: The UI should be a simple search bar with a input field and a submit button. It should be responsive and mobile-friendly.

components.name: SearchBarContainer
components.description: (standalone): The outer container for the search bar.

components.name: SearchInput
components.description: (standalone): The input field for the search query.
components.html: <input type="search" id="search" class="w-full p-2 pl-10 text-sm text-gray-700" placeholder="{search_placeholder}" />

components.name: SearchButton
components.description: (standalone): The submit button for the search.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">  {search_button_text}</button>

Year/Month Picker Calendars.description: The UI should display a responsive, mobile-first calendar picker that allows users to select a year and month. The calendar should be accessible and SEO-friendly.

components.name: YearMonthPicker
components.description: a standalone component that contains the year and month pickers.

components.name: YearPicker
components.description: a standalone component that allows users to select a year.
components.html: <select class="block w-full p-2 pl-10 text-sm text-gray-700">  <option value="{year1}">{year1}</option>  <option value="{year2}">{year2}</option>  <!-- more options --></select>

components.name: MonthPicker
components.description: a standalone component that allows users to select a month.
components.html: <select class="block w-full p-2 pl-10 text-sm text-gray-700">  <option value="{month1}">{month1}</option>  <option value="{month2}">{month2}</option>  <!-- more options --></select>

components.name: CalendarHeader
components.description: a standalone component that displays the current year and month.
components.html: {current_year} {current_month}

components.description: A standalone component that represents the text input field.
components.html: <input type="text" class="w-full p-2 border border-gray-200 rounded" />

components.name: CharacterCounter
components.description: A standalone component that displays the remaining characters available for a tweet.
components.html: Characters remaining: {remaining_characters}

Character counter for tweet length.description: The UI should display a text input field where the user can type their tweet. Below the input field, a counter should display the number of characters remaining, indicating how many more characters the user can type before reaching the tweet limit (280 characters).

components.name: TweetInput
components.description: a standalone component that takes a text input.
components.html: <input   type="text"   class="w-full p-2 pl-10 text-sm text-gray-700"   placeholder="Type your tweet..."/>

components.name: CharacterCounter
components.description: a standalone component that displays the remaining character count.
components.html: {remaining_characters} characters remaining

Breadcrumb navigation for category and s.description: The UI should display a breadcrumb navigation for categories and subreddits. Each item in the breadcrumb should display the category name and have a separator (e.g., `/`) between each item.
Breadcrumb navigation for category and s.html:
<nav class="flex items-center mb-4">
  <BreadCrumbNavigation>
    <BreadCrumb />
    <BreadCrumb />
    <!-- Add more Breadcrumbs as needed -->
  </BreadCrumbNavigation>
</nav>

components.name: BreadCrumb
components.description: standalone component that renders a single breadcrumb item.
components.html: • {category_name} /

components.name: BreadCrumbNavigation
components.description: container component that takes children (multiple `BreadCrumb` components).
components.html: {children}

Social Sharing Buttons.description: The UI should display a horizontal row of social media sharing buttons, each with an icon and a text label. The buttons should be medium-sized, round, and have a slight hover effect. The row should be centered and have some padding.

components.description: (standalone): a single social media sharing button with an icon and text label
components.html: {social_media_name}

components.name: SocialSharingButtonsRow
components.description: (takes children): a horizontal row of social sharing buttons
components.html: {children}

Toast/Notification Messages.description: The UI should display a notification message that appears at the top of the screen, with a background color indicating the type of message (e.g. success, error, warning). The message should be easily readable and have a close button to dismiss it.

components.name: NotificationMessage
components.description: standalone component that displays a single notification message.
components.html: {message}

components.name: NotificationCloseButton
components.description: standalone component that renders a close button for the notification message.
components.html: <button aria-label="Close notification" className="text-orange-500 hover:text-orange-700 transition duration-300">  </button>

Toast/Notification Messages.description: A toast/notification message is a small, non-obtrusive message that appears at the top or bottom of the screen, informing the user of a particular event or action. It usually disappears after a few seconds.

Tag and Category Navigation.description: The UI should display a navigation menu with tags and categories. The menu should be responsive, mobile-first, and accessible. On larger screens, the menu should be displayed horizontally, while on smaller screens, it should be displayed vertically.
Tag and Category Navigation.html:
<nav className="flex flex-wrap justify-center mb-4 lg:flex-no-wrap">
  <NavigationView>
    <!-- category items -->
    <CategoryItem>Category 1</CategoryItem>
    <CategoryItem>Category 2</CategoryItem>
    <!-- tag items -->
    <TagItem>tag 1</TagItem>
    <TagItem>tag 2</TagItem>
  </NavigationView>
</nav>

components.name: TagItem
components.description: a standalone component that displays a single tag.
components.html: {tagName}

components.name: CategoryItem
components.description: a standalone component that displays a single category.
components.html: {categoryName}

components.name: NavigationView
components.description: a component that takes children (tags and categories) to display the navigation menu.
components.html: {children}

Tag and Category Navigation.description: The UI should be a navigation bar with two sections: Tags and Categories. Each section should have a header and a list of items. The tags and categories should be clickable.
Tag and Category Navigation.html:
<nav class="flex justify-between">
  <NavItemGroup>
    <NavHeader>Tags</NavHeader>
    <!-- list of tags -->
    <TagNavItem/><TagNavItem/><TagNavItem/>
  </NavItemGroup>
  <NavItemGroup>
    <NavHeader>Categories</NavHeader>
    <!-- list of categories -->
    <CategoryNavItem/><CategoryNavItem/><CategoryNavItem/>
  </NavItemGroup>
</nav>

components.name: TagNavItem
components.description: a standalone component representing a single tag item in the navigation bar.
components.html: {tag_name}

components.name: CategoryNavItem
components.description: a standalone component representing a single category item in the navigation bar.
components.html: {category_name}

components.name: NavItemGroup
components.description: a component that takes children, representing a group of navigation items (e.g. Tags or Categories).
components.html: {children}

components.name: NavHeader
components.description: a standalone component representing a header for a navigation group.
components.html: {header_text}

Message input field with send button and.description: A responsive, mobile-first input field with a send button and an emoji picker. The input field should be accessible and SEO-friendly. On mobile devices, the input field should take up the full width of the screen, and the send button should be anchored to the right side of the screen. On larger screens, the input field should have a maximum width, and the send button should be aligned to the right of the input field. The emoji picker should be a popup that appears below the input field when the emoji button is clicked.

components.name: MessageInputField
components.description: (standalone): the input field where the user types the message
components.html: <input type="text" class="w-full px-4 py-2 mb-2 text-lg md:w-3/4" placeholder="Type a message..."/>

components.name: SendButton
components.description: (standalone): the button that sends the message
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Send</button>

components.name: EmojiButton
components.description: (standalone): the button that toggles the emoji picker
components.html: <button class="bg-gray-200 hover:bg-gray-300 text-gray-600 font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded"></button>

components.name: EmojiPicker
components.description: (takes children): the popup that displays a grid of emojis, each a clickable `Emoji` component
components.html: {children}

components.name: Emoji
components.description: (standalone): a single emoji character, clickable to insert into the input field
components.html: <button class="text-2xl">{emoji_character}</button>

Message input field with send button and.description: The UI should be a message input field with a send button and an emoji picker. The input field should be responsive and mobile-friendly. The send button should be enabled only when the input field has some text. The emoji picker should be a dropdown list that appears when the user clicks on the emoji icon. The UI should be accessible, with clear labels and high contrast colors.

components.name: MessageInputField
components.description: standalone component that renders an input field.
components.html: <input type="text" class="w-full p-2 pl-10 text-sm text-gray-700" placeholder="Type a message..." />

components.name: SendButton
components.description: standalone component that renders a button.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded" disabled={isDisabled}>Send</button>

components.name: EmojiPicker

{emojis.map((emoji) => (
  • {emoji}
    • ))}

components.html: <button class="p-2 hover:bg-gray-100 rounded text-lg">{children}</button>

Cookie Banners.description: A cookie banner is a notification that appears at the top or bottom of a webpage, informing users about the use of cookies on the website. It should be a non-obtrusive, dismissible notification that contains a message, an accept button, and an optional link to learn more.

components.name: CookieBanner
components.description: Standalone component that contains the cookie banner message, accept button, and optional link.
components.html:
{cookie_message}

{optional_link && ( {optional_link.text} )}

components.name: CookieButton
components.description: Standalone component that represents the accept button.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Accept</button>

Ships in {shipping_time} from {warehouse_location}

Radio/Checkbox Inputs.html:
<form className="max-w-md mx-auto p-4">
  <FormGroup>
    <RadioInput label="Option 1" name="radio-group" value="option1" />
    <RadioInput label="Option 2" name="radio-group" value="option2" />
    <RadioInput label="Option 3" name="radio-group" value="option3" />
  </FormGroup>
  <FormGroup>
    <CheckboxInput label="Checkbox 1" name=" checkbox1" />
    <CheckboxInput label="Checkbox 2" name="checkbox2" />
    <CheckboxInput label="Checkbox 3" name="checkbox3" />
  </FormGroup>
</form>

Semantic HTML5 Markup.description: The UI should be a basic web page with a header, navigation, main content area, and footer. The layout should be responsive and mobile-friendly.
Semantic HTML5 Markup.html:
<html lang="en">
  <head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
    <title>{title}</title>
  </head>
  <body class="min-h-screen flex flex-col">
    <HeaderComponent />
    <NavigationComponent />
    <main class="flex-1">
      <MainComponent>
        <!-- child components will be rendered here -->
      </MainComponent>
    </main>
    <FooterComponent />
  </body>
</html>

components.name: HeaderComponent
components.description: (standalone) - The topmost section of the page, containing the site's title and navigation.
components.html: {site_title}

components.name: NavigationComponent
components.description: (standalone) - A list of links to other parts of the site.
components.html:
• {nav_text_1}
  • {nav_text_2}

components.name: MainComponent
components.description: (takes children) - The main content area of the page, containing articles, images, or other content.
components.html: {children}

components.name: FooterComponent
components.description: (standalone) - The bottommost section of the page, containing copyright information and other miscellaneous links.
components.html: © {year} {site_name}

Semantic HTML5 Markup.description: A basic HTML5 document structure with semantic meaning, containing a header, navigation, main content area, sidebar, and footer.
Semantic HTML5 Markup.html:

  <head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
    <title>{document_title}</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <HeaderComponent />
    <NavComponent />
    <main>
      <MainComponent>
        <!-- Main content area -->
      </MainComponent>
    </main>
    <aside>
      <SidebarComponent />
    </aside>
    <FooterComponent />
  </body>
</html>

    <title>{title}</title>
  </head>
  <body class="min-h-screen flex flex-col">
    <HeaderComponent />
    <NavigationComponent />
    <main class="flex-1">
      <MainComponent>
        <!-- child components will be rendered here -->
      </MainComponent>
    </main>
    <FooterComponent />
  </body>
</html>

• {nav_text_1}

WYSIWYG/Rich Text Editors.description: A simple, minimalistic WYSIWYG/Rich Text Editor with a toolbar at the top and a contenteditable div below it. The toolbar should have buttons for formatting text (bold, italic, underline), aligning text (left, center, right), and inserting links. The contenteditable div should have a placeholder text "Start typing..." and should display the formatted text.

components.name: ToolBar
components.description: (standalone) - Contains buttons for formatting text and inserting links.

components.name: Editor
components.description: (takes children) - The contenteditable div that displays the formatted text.
components.html: {children}

components.name: FormatButton
components.description: (standalone) - A single button for formatting text (e.g., bold, italic, underline).
components.html: <button className="px-2 py-1 border border-gray-200 rounded-lg hover:bg-gray-100">  {format}</button>

components.name: AlignButton
components.description: (standalone) - A single button for aligning text (e.g., left, center, right).
components.html: <button className="px-2 py-1 border border-gray-200 rounded-lg hover:bg-gray-100">  {align}</button>

components.name: LinkButton
components.description: (standalone) - A button for inserting links.
components.html: <button className="px-2 py-1 border border-gray-200 rounded-lg hover:bg-gray-100">  Insert Link</button>

WYSIWYG/Rich Text Editors.description: A simple WYSIWYG/Rich Text Editor with a toolbar and a text area to edit and format text. The toolbar should have basic formatting options such as bold, italic, underline, font size, font family, and text alignment.

components.html: <button class="px-2 py-1 rounded" title={title}>  <i class={`fas fa-{icon}`} /></button>

WYSIWYG/Rich Text Editors.description: A simple, minimalistic WYSIWYG/Rich Text Editor with a toolbar at the top and a contenteditable div below it. The toolbar should have buttons for formatting text (bold, italic, underline), aligning text (left, center, right), and inserting links. The contenteditable div should have a placeholder text "Start typing..." and should display the formatted text.

components.name: ToolBar
components.description: (standalone) - Contains buttons for formatting text and inserting links.

components.name: Editor
components.description: (takes children) - The contenteditable div that displays the formatted text.
components.html: {children}

components.name: FormatButton
components.description: (standalone) - A single button for formatting text (e.g., bold, italic, underline).
components.html: <button className="px-2 py-1 border border-gray-200 rounded-lg hover:bg-gray-100">  {format}</button>

components.name: AlignButton
components.description: (standalone) - A single button for aligning text (e.g., left, center, right).
components.html: <button className="px-2 py-1 border border-gray-200 rounded-lg hover:bg-gray-100">  {align}</button>

components.name: LinkButton
components.description: (standalone) - A button for inserting links.
components.html: <button className="px-2 py-1 border border-gray-200 rounded-lg hover:bg-gray-100">  Insert Link</button>

Search Bar: Input field for searching co.description: The UI should be a simple search bar with an input field and a submit button. The input field should be responsive and adapt to different screen sizes. The search bar should be accessible, with a clear label and a submit button that can be clicked or pressed using the keyboard.

components.name: SearchInput
components.description: a standalone component that represents the input field.
components.html: <input   type="search"   id="search-input"   class="w-full pl-4 pr-10 text-sm text-gray-700"   placeholder="Search..."  aria-label="Search input"/>

components.name: SearchButton
components.description: a standalone component that represents the submit button.
components.html: <button   type="submit"   class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">  {search_button_text}</button>

components.name: ClearButton

components.html: <button class="text-gray-400 hover:text-gray-600 transition duration-300">  <!-- clear icon will go here --></button>

Pagination/Infinite Scroll.description: The UI should display a list of items with pagination controls at the bottom. The pagination controls should have options to navigate to previous and next pages. If the user reaches the end of the list, an "Load more" button should appear to load more items.

components.name: PaginationControls
components.description: (standalone) - Displays the pagination controls.
components.html: Prev Next Load more

components.name: PaginationButtonItem
components.description: (standalone) - A single pagination button (e.g. "Prev", "Next", etc.).
components.html: <button class="bg-gray-200 hover:bg-gray-300 text-gray-800 font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">{button_label}</button>

components.name: LoadMoreButton
components.description: (standalone) - The "Load more" button.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">{load_more_label}</button>

components.name: ListItem
components.description: (takes children) - A single item in the list.
components.html: • {children}

Logout button with confirmation prompt.description: A logout button that, when clicked, displays a confirmation prompt to ensure the user intends to log out. The prompt should have a warning tone and provide a clear call-to-action to confirm logout.
Logout button with confirmation prompt.html: Are you sure you want to log out?

components.name: ConfirmationPrompt
components.description: (takes children): A modal dialog with a warning tone that confirms the user's intention to log out.

Repository Search and Filtering Tool.description: The UI should be a responsive search bar with a dropdown list of repositories that can be filtered by keywords. It should also include a pagination system to navigate through the search results.
Repository Search and Filtering Tool.html:
<main class="max-w-md mx-auto p-4">
  <SearchBar />
  <RepositoryList>
    <!-- repository items will be rendered here -->
  </RepositoryList>
  <Pagination />
</main>

Community Forum and Chat Tools.description: The UI should be a responsive community forum and chat tools page that allows users to discuss topics, ask questions, and interact with each other through a chat system. The page should be divided into two main sections: a forum section that displays a list of discussion topics, and a chat section that allows users to send messages to each other.
Community Forum and Chat Tools.html:
Community Forum

Chat

components.name: ForumTopicCard
components.description: A standalone component that displays a single discussion topic, including the topic title, description, and number of replies.
components.html:
{topicTitle}

{topicDescription}

{replyCount} replies

components.name: ForumTopicList
components.description: A component that takes children (a list of **ForumTopicCard** components) and displays them in a scrollable list.
components.html: {children}

components.name: ChatInput
components.description: A standalone component that allows users to input and send messages.
components.html: <form class="flex mb-4">  <input type="text" class="w-full p-2 pl-10 text-gray-700" placeholder="Type a message...">  <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Send</button></form>

components.name: ChatMessage
components.description: A standalone component that displays a single chat message, including the sender's username and message text.
components.html:
{username}

{messageText}

components.name: ChatMessageList
components.description: A component that takes children (a list of **ChatMessage** components) and displays them in a scrollable list.
components.html: {children}

Telephone/Phone Number Inputs.description: The UI should be a simple input field with a label, allowing users to enter their phone number. The input field should be responsive and adapt to different screen sizes.

components.name: PhoneNumberInput
components.description: standalone component
components.html: <input type="tel"        class="block w-full pl-10 text-sm text-gray-700"        id="{id}"        placeholder="Enter your phone number"        pattern="[0-9]{3} [0-9]{3} [0-9]{4}"        required />

Reporting Dashboard: Generate data insig.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first dashboard that displays various data insights in a clear and organized manner. The dashboard should have a top navigation bar, a sidebar with navigation options, and a main content area that displays different charts, graphs, and data tables.

components.name: NavigationBar
components.description: - Standalone - Displays the top navigation bar with a dashboard title and navigation links.
components.html:
{dashboard_title}

  • {nav_link1}
  • {nav_link2}

components.name: Sidebar
components.description: - Standalone - Displays the sidebar with navigation options.
components.html:
• {sidebar_link1}
  • {sidebar_link2}

components.name: DataCard
components.description: - Takes children - Displays a single data insight, such as a chart or graph, with a title and description.
components.html:
{title}

{description}

{children}

components.name: DataSection
components.description: - Takes children - Displays a section of data insights, such as a row of charts or graphs.
components.html: {children}

components.name: DataTable
components.description: - Takes children - Displays a table of data with column headers and rows.
components.html: {children}

Reporting Dashboard: Generate data insig.description: The UI should display a structured overview of data insights, providing an at-a-glance view of key metrics and trends. The layout should be clean, modern, and easy to navigate, with clear headings, concise labels, and prominent use of data visualization elements.

components.name: DashboardHeader
components.description: Standalone component displaying the title and navigation for the dashboard.
components.html:
{dashboard_title}

  • {nav_item_1}
  • {nav_item_2}

components.name: MetricCard
components.description: Component that takes children, displaying a single key metric (e.g., "Total Users") with a value and optional visualization (e.g., chart, gauge).
components.html:
{metric_label}

{metric_value}

{children}

components.name: TrendChart
components.description: Standalone component rendering a line chart or area chart to illustrate trends over time.
components.html:
{chart_title}

{chart_data}

components.name: DataGrid
components.description: Component that takes children, displaying a sortable, paginated table of data with customizable columns.
components.html:
{children}
{column_header_1} {column_header_2} {column_header_3}

components.description: Standalone component providing filters and sorting options for the data grid.

Voice Command/Audio Feedback.description: The UI should be a simple audio feedback component that visually indicates when the voice command is listening and provides a visual cue for audio feedback.

components.name: AudioIndicator
components.description: A standalone component that indicates when the voice command is listening. It will be a circle that changes color to indicate when the voice command is active.

components.name: AudioFeedback
components.description: A standalone component that provides a visual cue for audio feedback. It will display a waveform or a similar visual representation of the audio input.

Voice Command/Audio Feedback.description: The UI should display a microphone icon and a circle that represents the audio feedback. The microphone icon should be surrounded by a circle that changes color based on the audio feedback level. The UI should also display a text that indicates the audio feedback level.

components.name: MicrophoneIcon
components.description: A standalone component that displays a microphone icon.
components.html: <i class="fas fa-microphone text-lg text-gray-500" />

components.name: AudioFeedbackCircle
components.description: A standalone component that displays a circle that changes color based on the audio feedback level.
components.html: <div class={`w-12 h-12 bg-${audio_feedback_level_color} rounded-full`} />

components.name: AudioFeedbackText
components.description: A standalone component that displays the audio feedback level.
components.html: {audio_feedback_level_text}

Post Text Editor: Input field for writin.description: A minimalist text editor for writing a new post, consisting of a text input field with a subtle border, padding, and a hint of typography. The input field should be responsive, taking up the full width on mobile devices and shrinking to a comfortable size on larger screens.

components.name: TextInput
components.description: (standalone): A simple text input field with a label and minimal styling.

The input field should be responsive, taking up the full width on mobile devices and shrinking to a comfortable size on larger screens.

Post Text Editor: Input field for writin.description: The UI should be a simple text input field with a placeholder for writing a new post. It should be responsive, mobile-first, and accessible.

components.name: PostEditor
components.description: A standalone component that contains the text input field.

components.name: InputField
components.description: A standalone component that represents the text input field.
components.html: <textarea  class="w-full p-2 pl-4 pr-4 bg-gray-100 rounded-md focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500"  placeholder="Write a new post..."  rows="5"></textarea>

Search Bar and Filters.description: The UI should be a search bar with filters, allowing users to search for specific items and filter the results by different criteria. The search bar should be responsive and mobile-friendly, with the filters hidden on smaller screens and revealed on larger screens.

components.name: SearchBar
components.description: (standalone) - A input field where users can type their search queries.
components.html: <input type="search" class="w-full p-2 pl-10 text-sm" placeholder="Search..." />

components.name: FilterButton
components.description: (standalone) - A button that toggles the visibility of the filters.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">  Filters</button>

components.name: FilterMenu
components.description: (takes children) - A dropdown menu containing the filter options.
components.html: {children}

components.name: FilterOption
components.description: (standalone) - A single filter option within the FilterMenu.
components.html: <button class="block w-full p-2 hover:bg-gray-200">{filter_label}</button>

Search Bar and Filters.description: The UI should be a search bar with filters, allowing users to search for specific items and apply filters to narrow down the results. The search bar should be prominent and centered, with filters displayed below it.

components.name: SearchBar
components.description: Standalone component for the search input field.
components.html: <input   type="search"   id="search-input"   class="w-full py-2 px-4 border-2 border-gray-200 rounded-lg"  placeholder="Search..."/>

components.name: FilterButton
components.description: Standalone component for each filter button.
components.html: <button   class="bg-white hover:bg-gray-100 text-gray-800 font-semibold py-2 px-4 border border-gray-400 rounded">  {filter_name}</button>

components.name: FilterMenu
components.description: Component that wraps all filter buttons, takes children.
components.html: {children}

components.name: SearchAndFilters
components.description: Component that wraps the search bar and filter menu, takes children.
components.html: {children}

Search Bar and Filters.description: A responsive search bar with filters above a results list. The search bar should be placed on top of a rectangular box with a subtle shadow. The filters should be represented as buttons that toggle on and off when clicked.

components.name: FilterButton
components.description: standalone component
components.html: <button  class="bg-gray-200 hover:bg-gray-300 text-gray-800 font-semibold py-2 px-4 border border-gray-400 rounded">  {filterLabel}</button>

components.name: Filters
components.description: takes children (FilterButton components)
components.html: {children}

Features Grid: Highlight key benefits in.description: A responsive grid layout with 3-4 columns, showcasing key benefits of a product or service. Each grid item should have an icon, a heading, and a brief description.
Features Grid: Highlight key benefits in.html:
<section class="container mx-auto p-4 lg:p-8">
  <FeaturesGrid>
    <FeatureItem/>
    <FeatureItem/>
    <FeatureItem/>
    <!-- Add more FeatureItem components as needed -->
  </FeaturesGrid>
</section>

components.name: FeatureItem
components.description: (standalone): A single feature item in the grid, containing an icon, heading, and description.
components.html:
{heading}

{description}

components.name: FeaturesGrid
components.description: (takes children): The container element for the feature items, managing the grid layout.
components.html: {children}

Product Image Gallery: Showcase your pro.description: The UI should display a product image gallery with multiple images showcasing the product from different angles. The gallery should be responsive, accessible, and SEO-friendly. On mobile devices, the gallery should be swipeable, and on desktop devices, it should have navigation arrows.

components.description: The main component that contains the image gallery. This component takes children.
components.html: {children}

components.name: ProductImage
components.description: A single image in the gallery. This component is standalone.

components.name: NavigationArrow
components.description: An arrow button for navigating through the images. This component is standalone.

Product filtering and sorting controls.description: The UI should display a set of filtering and sorting controls for products, allowing users to narrow down their search results by category, price range, and rating. There should be a dropdown for selecting filters (e.g. "Unread", "Starred", etc.), a dropdown for selecting sorting methods (e.g. "Oldest", "Newest", etc.), and a button to apply the selected filters and sorting.

components.name: SortDropdown

components.name: ThemeOption
components.description: (standalone): a single theme option with a preview and a checkbox to select it
components.html: {theme_name}

components.name: ThemeSelector
components.description: (takes children): a container for a list of theme options
components.html: {children}

Webcam/Camera Interfaces.description: The UI should display a webcam/video camera interface with a live feed, a capture button, and a toggle switch to switch between the front and rear cameras.

components.name: WebcamFeed
components.description: (standalone) - displays the live webcam feed

components.name: CaptureButton
components.description: (standalone) - a button to capture a photo/video
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">  Capture</button>

components.name: CameraToggle
components.description: (standalone) - a toggle switch to switch between the front and rear cameras

Social Sharing: Buttons for sharing cont.description: The UI should be a horizontal row of social media sharing buttons, each with an icon and a brief label. The buttons should be evenly spaced and have a subtle hover effect. On mobile devices, the buttons should stack vertically to accommodate smaller screens.

components.name: SocialShareButton
components.description: Standalone component, represents a single social media sharing button.

components.name: SocialShareButtonGroup
components.description: Component that takes children, represents the container for the social media sharing buttons.
components.html: {children}

Add to cart and wishlist buttons.description: The UI should be a simple container with two buttons, one for adding to cart and one for adding to wishlist. The buttons should be responsive and accessible.

components.name: AddToCartButton
components.description: standalone
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">  Add to Cart</button>

components.name: AddToWishlistButton
components.description: standalone
components.html: <button class="bg-gray-500 hover:bg-gray-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">  Add to Wishlist</button>

components.name: ButtonContainer
components.description: takes children
components.html: {children}
